intro: Galeopsis nadalii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved horse mint, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, blue to purple flowers are arranged in whorled clusters along the stems. Galeopsis nadalii is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
